headline.main: SCIENTIFIC CONVENTION,; Speeches of Hitchcock, Agassiz and others. Inaguration of the State Geological Hall. American Association for the Advancement of Science. Adipocere-Why Bodies Turn in the Coffins--How Prof. Alexander would have been Kepler--The Association's Troubles. Agassiz on One-Celled Animals--The Growth of Plants--Turtles and Sharks, Important Investigations at Sandy Hook. NEW DISCOVERIES ANNOUNCED. HINTS TO NATURALISTS.

NEW-YORK CITY.; Commissioners of Health--No Yellow Fever at Quaruntino. SANITARY CONDITION OF THE CITY. Commissioners of Emigration. POLICE INTELLIGENCE. The "Castle of Montgomery." U. S. CIRCUIT COURT-SPECIAL SESSION. Fremant and Dayton Central Club. Naval. Brooklyn Board of Health. Alarm is Jersey City. Small-Pox at Quarantine. Miecellaneous.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Commission met as usual yesterday. headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Cousolidated Repablicanism. CITY POLITICS. Commissioners of Health. SANITARY CONDITION OF THE CITY. Very Sharp. POLICE INTELLIGENCE. Brooklyn Bonrd of Health. Incendiary Fire in Hudson street.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republician Association of the Eighteenth Ward and the Eighteenth Ward Fremont Club were consolidated on Monday evening, and chose HOMER FRANKLIN, President; S. V. BAGLEY, HENRY BREWSTER, BENJAMIN WARDEN, and WILLIAM D. CHASE, Vice-Presidents; RICHARD WYNKOOP,and WILLIAM BOIES, Secretaries; WILLIAM K. STRONG, Treasurer. The Delegation to the Central Committee remains unchanged.

headline.main: SCIENTIFIC CONVENTION.; A Conestitutional Battle--Confusion in the Camp and Spicy Scenes. American Association for the Advancement of Science. Are we all of One Blood?--The Giant's Wrestling-Bones and Relics Writing the History of Men-Ozone in the Air-Instruments of Budley Observatory. A LETTER FROM MAYOR WOOD.
NEW-JERSEY.; Sudden Death. Examinatior of Counterfeiters.

docs.lead_paragraph: Examination of Counterfeiters. Yesterday HENRY JOHNSON and his son CHARLES JOHNSON--arrested in Jersey City last Thursday might on the charge of counterfeiting--were examined before Recorder REDFORD. Justice PEAROY, of New-York, appeared as their counsel. The Recorder held them for trial at the next term of Court, if indicated. Hon. PRESTON KING, of New-York, will speak at the Jersey City mass meeting, to be hold this day and evening.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Sudden Death in Church-street. Capure of a Pickpocket. The Late Countens Bondeau Smuggliag Case. Sudden Death at a Police Station. Yellow Fever In Kings County. Military Funeral. Brooklyn Board of Health. Sale of the Plymouth House Furniture. A Shaker Visit and Discussion--Funny Doings. Arrival of the Last Cable.

docs.lead_paragraph: Commissioners of Health. The Board met yesterday, at the City Hall. Present, ISAAC O. BARKER, Esq., WALTER F. CONCKLIN, Secretary, and a quorum of members. The following cases were reported upon by the Health Officer for the final action of the Board, with the annexed results:

headline.main: SARATOGA.; People and Things at Saratoga--Sketches of Life.

docs.lead_paragraph: It would take a book to relate what we see in one day from our window, and the comments we make thereon, but we really think it would be book worth reading, for we see many a romance and many a thrilling tale. We heard, not long ago, the story of a lady who came here twenty years ago, rich and beautiful,
